articles.title: Mexico’s Congress approves tariff hikes on imports from China and others
articles.description: MEXICO CITY (AP) — Mexico’s Congress approved Wednesday most of the tariff increases proposed by the government on more than 1,400 products imported from China and other countries that do not have free trade agreements with Mexico. articles.title: Edmonton’s Whitemud Drive set for road widening
articles.description: Drivers in West Edmonton have been dreading this stretch of Whitemud Drive from 215 Street to 231 Street for years. articles.title: Connor Hellebuyck returns to practice for Winnipeg Jets
articles.description: Connor Hellebuyck took part in Wednesday's practice, but Jets head coach Scott Arniel is still unsure of his timeline to return.

articles.title: Venezuela condemns ‘act of piracy’ after U.S. seizes sanctioned oil tanker off its coast
articles.description: Venezuela called the seizure a ‘blatant theft,’ adding that the action reveals oil as ‘the true reason’ for U.S. aggression against the country

articles.title: Calgary bracing for cold snap with wild temperature swings ahead
articles.description: Calgarians are in for a rollercoaster of weather this week, as temperatures in the city swing from mild conditions on Wednesday to bone-chilling lows by Thursday night, before rebounding to spring-like highs early next week. articles.title: Family of slain Kelowna woman hopes ‘politicking’ doesn’t stall Bailey’s Law
articles.description: The grief-stricken family of Bailey McCourt has been tirelessly pushing for change to better protect victims of intimate partner violence.

articles.title: Coca-Cola names a company veteran as its new CEO
articles.description: Coca-Cola said Wednesday that its chief operating officer will become its next CEO in the first quarter of 2026. articles.title: ‘He’ll be next’: Donald Trump threatens Colombian President Gustavo Petro
articles.description: The Republican renewed his threats against Colombia, blaming its left-wing leader for the country's cocaine production.

articles.title: Anti-abortion billboards in West Kelowna, B.C. to be taken down
articles.description: '(The lawyers) said that if BC Billboards is publishing pro-life billboards and not mine, then it’s considered sex-based discrimination,' Harms explained.

articles.title: Vancouver councillor motions to bring back Chinatown post office
articles.description: The fight for a critical community resource in Vancouver's Chinatown continues.

articles.title: Transcontinental reports lower quarterly profit after announcing sale of packaging business
articles.description: Montreal-based company’s revenue was $732.4-million for the period ended Oct. 26, down from $749.3-million a year earlier

articles.title: In surprise move, ABC Vancouver scraps local procurement requirement for mega-developments
articles.description: Vancouver's community benefits agreement policy "looks great on paper and it sounds great, but it doesn't actually accomplish anything additional," said ABC Vancouver Coun. Brian Montague, who proposed removing the requirement. "I'm a big believer in less government."

articles.title: NHL brass still concerned about Olympic rink at upcoming Milan Games
articles.description: NHL commissioner Gary Bettman was in Winnipeg on Wednesday and said he still has concerns over the Olympic hockey venue.

articles.title: China’s Oil Hoarding Clouds Outlook for Slowing Demand Growth
articles.description: China’s robust stockpiling of crude is expected to continue next year, helping to cushion global markets from a swelling surplus, but masking a broader trend of slowing oil demand growth.

articles.title: Experts warn Alberta could be in for tough flu season
articles.description: It seems many Albertans are kicking off the holiday season sick. articles.title: Quebec Liberals under investigation by anti-corruption police UPAC
articles.description: The Liberals are facing allegations of possible vote-buying during a leadership race earlier this year that saw Rodriguez take the reins of the party.

articles.title: Simple Plan returning to Montreal for holiday benefit concert
articles.description: Simple Plan is coming home for the holidays with an intimate, one-night-only benefit concert in Montreal, marking the return of a long-running tradition and a milestone year for the band’s charitable foundation. articles.title: Mexico Approves Up to 50% Tariffs on Chinese, Asian Imports
articles.description: Mexican lawmakers gave final approval for new tariffs on Asian imports, broadly aligning with US efforts to tighten trade barriers against China, as President Claudia Sheinbaum seeks to protect local industry.

articles.title: Indigenous deaths in custody in Australia hit highest level since 1980
articles.description: New figures show that 33 of the 113 deaths in custody between last July and this June were Indigenous
